DOC.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study SB797620 Healthy Japanese Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy subject They Japanese male . Aged 20 55 year , inclusive . They body mass index screen within 18.525.0 . Body weight 5080kg . AST ( GOT ) , ALT ( GPT ) , gummaGPT ALP : upper normal range They capable give write informed consent , include compliance requirement restriction list consent form . They could refrain smoke hospitalization . They able attend visit complete study . The subject clinically relevant abnormality medical examination , vital sign , clinical laboratory test medical history screen medical opinion investigator subject medical history consider eligible inclusion study investigator . Known hepatic biliary abnormality Gilbert 's syndrome . Use insulin oral antihyperglycemic agent within past 3 month prior screen . Subjects history lactose intolerance . The subject allergy drug idiosyncrasy . This exclude pollen allergy without current symptom . The subject currently participate another clinical study postmarketing study subject expose investigational noninvestigational drug device . The subject participate clinical study investigational noninvestigational drug device previous 4 month . The subject screening ECG QTc value outside range 320 450msec , PR interval > 230msec and/or QRS interval > 120msec . The subject heart rate outside range 40 110 bpm screening . The subject donate unit blood `` > 400mL '' within previous 4 month `` > 200mL '' within previous 1 month . The subject currently take regular ( course ) medication ( include prescribe drug , overthecounter medication herbal remedy ) , cease 30 day prior th first study drug dosing . The subject history current condition drug abuse alcoholism . History alcohol consumption past six month exceed 7 drink per week ( 1 drink 350mL term beer ) The subject positive syphilis , HBs antigen , HCV antibody , HIV antigen/antibody , HTLV1 antibody . The subject positive urine drug screening . Current history hypo hyperglycemia indicate serum glucose value laboratoryspecified reference range =110 mg/dL , screening , report subject .
